news_items.headline: Amazon challenges India antitrust probe in court: filing
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc has begun legal action in India to quash an antitrust investigation against the company, saying it could cause "irreparable" loss and damage to its reputation, according to its court filing seen by Reuters.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: People move past a hoarding of Amazon India outside a metro rail station in New Delhi, India, October 23, 2019. REUTERS/Anushree Fadnavis/File Photo

news_items.headline: Amazon names Sony executive to lead entertainment unit
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc on Monday tapped Sony Corp executive Mike Hopkins to lead its Prime video platform as well as its movie and television studios.

news_items.headline: Amazon names Sony executive to lead  entertainment unit -WSJ
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc named Sony Corp executive Mike Hopkins to lead its Prime video platform as well as its movie and television studios, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

news_items.headline: BRIEF-Amazon Stockpiling On Products Made In China Due To Coronavirus Risk On Its Supply Chain- Business Insider
news_items.lede: * AMAZON STOCKPILING ON PRODUCTS MADE IN CHINA DUE TO CORONAVIRUS RISK ON ITS SUPPLY CHAIN - BUSINESS INSIDER, CITING LEAKED EMAILS Source: http://bit.ly/2UEYCH9 Further company coverage:

news_items.headline: Amazon wants Trump to testify on ‘order to screw Amazon’ in Pentagon deal
news_items.lede: Amazon Web Services said on Monday it was seeking to depose President Donald Trump and Defense Secretary Mark Esper in its lawsuit over whether the president was trying "to screw Amazon" when the Pentagon awarded a contract for cloud computing to rival Microsoft Corp. <MSFT.O...
news_items.img_cap: The logo of Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seen during the 4th annual America Digital Latin American Congress of Business and Technology in Santiago, Chile, September 5, 2018. REUTERS/Ivan Alvarado

news_items.headline: Amazon pulls out of major Barcelona telecoms conference over coronavirus
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> has pulled out of this month's Mobile World Congress because of the coronavirus outbreak, in another blow to one of the telecom industry's biggest gatherings which attracts over 100,000 visitors to Barcelona.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, August 8, 2018. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

news_items.headline: Lifeblood of Amazon merchants threatened as coronavirus infects Chinese workers
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> sellers are bracing for product shortages as Chinese workers - worried about the fast-spreading coronavirus - may be unable or unwilling to return to idled factories.
news_items.img_cap: Bernie Thompson of Plugable Technologies shows a docking station that he sells on Amazon.com from his facility in Redmond, Washington, U.S., February 6, 2020.   REUTERS/Lindsey Wasson

news_items.headline: Disney's weapon against Netflix and Amazon in India: Hotstar
news_items.lede: When Walt Disney Co's Disney+ streaming service makes its debut in India on March 29, it will enjoy the luxury of home-court advantage: Hotstar.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A man looks at his phone as he passes by a screen advertising Walt Disney's streaming service Disney+ in New York City, U.S., November 12, 2019. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

news_items.headline: Amazon's AWS to invest $236 million in Brazil to strengthen cloud infrastructure
news_items.lede: The cloud computing unit of U.S. Amazon.com Inc will invest 1 billion reais ($236.18 million) in the Brazilian state of Sao Paulo over the next two years, the state government said on Wednesday, to strengthen its infrastructure in South America.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seen during the 4th annual America Digital Latin American Congress of Business and Technology in Santiago, Chile, September 5, 2018. REUTERS/Ivan Alvarado

news_items.headline: Bezos asks U.S. judge to dismiss lawsuit by girlfriend's brother: Bloomberg
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> Chief Executive Officer Jeff Bezos is urging a U.S. judge to dismiss a defamation lawsuit filed against him by the brother of his girlfriend Lauren Sanchez, Bloomberg reported https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-04/bezos-urges-judge-to-dismiss-suit-by-girlfriend-s-brother...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Jeff Bezos, president and CEO of Amazon and owner of The Washington Post, speaks at the Economic Club of Washington DC's "Milestone Celebration Dinner" in Washington, U.S., September 13, 2018. REUTERS/Joshua Roberts/File Photo

news_items.headline: Goldman in talks with Amazon to offer small business loans: FT
news_items.lede: Goldman Sachs Group Inc <GS.N> is in advanced talks with Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> to offer small- and medium-sized businesses loans in the United States on the e-commerce giant's lending platform, the Financial Times reported on Monday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A view of the Goldman Sachs stall on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange July 16, 2013. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo

news_items.headline: Goldman Sachs in talks with Amazon to offer small business loans - FT
news_items.lede: Goldman Sachs Group is in advanced talks with Amazon.com Inc to offer small business loans in the United States on the e-commerce giant's lending platform, the Financial Times reported on Monday.

news_items.headline: Amazon holiday quarter delivers, threatens profit squeeze for UPS and FedEx
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc's <AMZN.O> rapid expansion of one-day shipping delivered a strong holiday quarter and showed the rising ambition of the company, which in six years has created a network that handles nearly as many packages as FedEx Corp <FDX.N>.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, August 8, 2018. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol/File Photo

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Wall Street falls on virus concerns, Amazon limits losses
news_items.lede: * Indexes down: Dow 0.93%, S&P 0.65%, Nasdaq 0.38% (Updates to open)

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-S&P 500 opens lower on virus concerns, Amazon supports Nasdaq
news_items.lede: The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average opened lower on Friday, hit by worries over the impact of the coronavirus epidemic on global growth, while the Nasdaq was supported by strong earnings from Amazon.com Inc.

news_items.headline: Amazon holiday sales jump as one-day shipping pays dividends, stock up 13%
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> on Thursday posted holiday quarter results well above expectations as the expansion of its one-day shipping program came under budget and membership in its Prime loyalty club notched a 50% rise in two years.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, August 8, 2018. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol/File Photo

news_items.headline: Amazon beats holiday quarter sales estimates
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc on Thursday beat analysts' estimates for fourth-quarter revenue, as its efforts to speed up delivery helped attract more shoppers during the holiday season.

news_items.headline: UPS doubling down on weekend deliveries as e-commerce booms and Amazon looms
news_items.lede: United Parcel Service Inc <UPS.N> said it aims to more than double weekend deliveries in 2020 as package carriers look for ways to satisfy the always-on demands of e-commerce customers, including rising rival Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O>. The world's biggest online retailer pioneered...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of United Parcel Service is seen at the new package sorting and delivery UPS hub in Corbeil-Essonnes and Evry, southern Paris, France, June 26, 2018.  REUTERS/Charles Platiau

news_items.headline: EBay forecast disappoints amid competition from Amazon, Walmart
news_items.lede: EBay Inc <EBAY.O> forecast first-quarter revenue below analysts' estimates on Tuesday, as the e-commerce company faces fierce competition from Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> and Walmart Inc <WMT.N>.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The German headquarters of online marketplace eBay is pictured at Europarc Dreilinden business park south of Berlin in Kleinmachnow, Germany, August 6, 2019. REUTERS/Fabrizio Bensch

news_items.headline: Amazon asks court to pause Microsoft's work on Pentagon's JEDI contract
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday it filed a motion in court to pause the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from carrying out an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal until a court rules on its protest of the contract award.
news_items.img_cap: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, November 5, 2019. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

news_items.headline: Carrefour set for 2019 profit growth after fourth quarter sales accelerate
news_items.lede: French supermarket retailer Carrefour <CARR.PA> said revenue growth accelerated in the fourth quarter driven by strong sales in Brazil, but transport strikes dampened business at its hypermarkets in France.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Carrefour logo is seen on a Carrefour Hypermarket store in Antibes, France May 6, 2019.   REUTERS/Eric Gaillard/File Photo  GLOBAL BUSINESS WEEK AHEAD

news_items.headline: CEOs should still do work with Saudi Arabia despite report: Mnuchin
news_items.lede: American business executives should still do business with Saudi Arabia, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday after a report on the kingdom's possible involvement in the hacking of Amazon CEO and Washington Post owner Jeff Bezos' phone.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin attends a session during the 50th World Economic Forum (WEF) annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland, January 22, 2020. REUTERS/Denis Balibouse

news_items.headline: Amazon files motion to halt Microsoft's work on Pentagon's JEDI contract
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc on Wednesday said it filed a motion to pause the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from carrying out an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal until a court rules on its protest of the contract award.

news_items.headline: Amazon Music crosses 55 million subscribers globally, trails Apple Music
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday its music streaming service had over 55 million customers globally, edging close to Apple Music but far behind Swedish rival Spotify.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, August 8, 2018. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol/File Photo

news_items.headline: After India's Amazon snub, Modi's party slams Bezos-owned Washington Post
news_items.lede: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's ruling party on Friday slammed editorial policies of billionaire Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post, even as his e-commerce firm Amazon <AMZN.O> announced plans to create a million jobs in the country by 2025.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Jeff Bezos, founder of Amazon, attends a company event in New Delhi, India, January 15, 2020. REUTERS/Anushree Fadnavis

news_items.headline: Amazon promises 1 mln new jobs in India amid tensions with govt
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc said on Friday it planned to create 1 million jobs in India by 2025, a day after the country's trade minister said the e-commerce giant's recently unveiled $1 billion investment in the country was no big favour.

news_items.headline: During Bezos visit, India minister says Amazon's $1 billion investment is no big favour
news_items.lede: Amazon <AMZN.O> hasn't done India any big favours by announcing a new $1 billion investment, its trade minister said on Thursday, laying bare tensions with the U.S. online retail giant during a visit to the country by its CEO Jeff Bezos.
news_items.img_cap: Jeff Bezos, founder of Amazon, and his girlfriend TV presenter Lauren Sanchez pose after arriving at a company event in Mumbai, India, January 16, 2020. REUTERS/Francis Mascarenhas

news_items.headline: Amazon orders electric vans from Deutsche Post's StreetScooter
news_items.lede: Amazon.com <AMZN.O> has ordered 40 electric vans from Deutsche Post's <DPWGn.DE> StreetScooter unit for deliveries in the German city of Munich as part of the plan to be carbon neutral by 2040, the online retailer said on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, November 5, 2019. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

news_items.headline: Under fire in India, Amazon offers small business owners $1 billion olive branch
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc CEO Jeff Bezos said his company will invest $1 billion to bring small businesses online in India, reaching out to some of his fiercest critics in a goodwill visit that saw him donning traditional Indian attire and fly a kite with children.
news_items.img_cap: Jeff Bezos, founder of Amazon, attends a company event in New Delhi, India, January 15, 2020. REUTERS/Anushree Fadnavis

news_items.headline: Amazon chief says to invest $1 bln in digitizing small businesses in India
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc will invest $1 billion in digitizing small- and medium-businesses in India and expects to export $10 billion worth of India-made goods by 2025, its founder Jeff Bezos said on Wednesday.

news_items.headline: Amazon says it is following order that bars Deliveroo loan
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> said on Tuesday it was complying with a regulatory order that has effectively barred it from lending money to UK food delivery group Deliveroo since June, rebutting a Bloomberg report that Amazon had made such an offer.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A biker wearing a Deliveroo backpack drives in the central Barcelona, Spain, July 23, 2019. REUTERS/Albert Gea/File Photo

news_items.headline: 'Game of Thrones' actors among Amazon's 'Lord of the Rings' cast
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> unveiled the first cast of actors for its highly anticipated "The Lord of the Rings" streaming television series on Tuesday, including two "Game of Thrones" veterans, and said production would begin in New Zealand next month.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Amazon.com logo and stock price information is seen on screens at the Nasdaq Market Site in New York City, New York, U.S., September 4, 2018. REUTERS/Mike Segar

news_items.headline: Amazon offers loan to Deliveroo amid UK probe - Bloomberg
news_items.lede: E-commerce giant Amazon.com Inc has offered a loan to food-delivery group Deliveroo as a UK probe into the start-up's last funding round unveiled threat of a cash crunch, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Amazon boss Jeff Bezos arrives in India as local traders plan protests
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> founder Jeff Bezos arrived in India on Tuesday, according to a post on his Twitter account, as thousands of small traders across 300 cities planned protests, claiming the firm is distorting local retail market.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Jeff Bezos, founder of Amazon and Blue Origin speaks  during the JFK Space Summit, celebrating the 50th anniversary of the moon landing, at the John F. Kennedy Library in Boston, Massachusetts, U.S., June 19, 2019. REUTERS/Katherine Taylor

news_items.headline: Amazon to seek order to block Microsoft from working on DoD's JEDI contract
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> will ask a judge to temporarily block Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> from working on a $10 billion cloud contract from the Pentagon, a court filing showed on Monday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, August 8, 2018. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

news_items.headline: Amazon to ramp up counterfeit reporting to law enforcement
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc is planning to give more data on counterfeit goods to law enforcement in a further crackdown on fakes listed on its e-commerce sites, a person familiar with the program told Reuters.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Amazon boxes are seen stacked for delivery in the Manhattan borough of New York City, January 29, 2016.    REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo/File Photo

news_items.headline: India orders antitrust probe of Amazon, Walmart's Flipkart
news_items.lede: India ordered an investigation of Amazon.com Inc and Walmart's Flipkart on Monday over alleged violations of competition law in the latest setback for U.S. e-commerce giants operating in the country.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: People move past a hoarding of Amazon India outside a metro rail station in New Delhi, India, October 23, 2019. REUTERS/Anushree Fadnavis/File Photo

news_items.headline: India orders antitrust probe against Amazon, Walmart's Flipkart
news_items.lede: India's antitrust body has ordered an investigation into alleged competition law violations by Amazon.com Inc and Walmart's Flipkart, it said in an order on Monday.

news_items.headline: As Amazon.com flexes its muscle, Seattle moves to curb corporate political donations
news_items.lede: Seattle, the Pacific Northwest city where home-grown online retailer Amazon.com has increasingly flexed its political muscle, is expected to approve on Monday legislation banning political contributions by companies with at least 5% foreign ownership.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: People take in the view from the top of the Space Needle in this aerial photo in Seattle, Washington, U.S. March 21, 2019. Picture taken March 21, 2019.  REUTERS/Lindsey Wasson

news_items.headline: REFILE-As Amazon.com flexes its muscle, Seattle moves to curb corporate political donations
news_items.lede: Seattle, the Pacific Northwest city where home-grown online retailer Amazon.com has increasingly flexed its political muscle, is expected to approve on Monday legislation banning political contributions by companies with at least 5% foreign ownership.

news_items.headline: Amazon boss Bezos to face protests from traders during India trip
news_items.lede: Thousands of small-scale traders in India are planning to organize protests against Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> founder Jeff Bezos, who will visit the country next week for a company event and potential meetings with government officials.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Jeff Bezos, founder of Amazon and Blue Origin speaks  during the JFK Space Summit, celebrating the 50th anniversary of the moon landing, at the John F. Kennedy Library in Boston, Massachusetts, U.S., June 19, 2019.  REUTERS/Katherine Taylor

news_items.headline: Alibaba undercuts Amazon in Europe to woo wary brands
news_items.lede: After years of reconnaissance, China's retail king Alibaba is finally making its move on Europe. It is undercutting Amazon sellers' fees to attract vendors but has had mixed results, six sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.
news_items.img_cap: The logo of AliExpress is seen at Alibaba Expansion office at the Alibaba company's headquarters in Hangzhou, Zhejiang province, China, November 18, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song

news_items.headline: Amazon to showcase its transportation drive at world's largest tech show
news_items.lede: From making cars talk using Alexa's voice to managing data from factories full of robots, Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> wants a big piece of the action in transportation, and this week at CES will unveil more about its strategy to achieve that goal than ever before.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, August 8, 2018. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol/File Photo

news_items.headline: Amazon Fire TV crosses 40 million active users globally
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc said on Monday its streaming device, Fire TV, has surpassed 40 million active users globally, maintaining its lead over rival Roku Inc.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The new Amazon Fire TV is displayed during a media event introducing new Amazon products in San Francisco, California September 16, 2015. REUTERS/Beck Diefenbach

news_items.headline: Amazon considers opening stores in Germany: report
news_items.lede: Amazon.com <AMZN.O> is considering opening stores in Germany, its second biggest market after the United States, the ecommerce company's head in the country was quoted as saying on Saturday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A customer leaves a new Amazon pop-up store for Christmas at Berlin's main shopping street Kurfurstendamm boulevard in Berlin, Germany, November 22, 2018. REUTERS/Fabrizio Bensch

news_items.headline: Amazon's Ring cameras are vulnerable to hackers, lawsuit in U.S. claims
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> and its Ring home security camera unit have been sued by an Alabama homeowner who said the cameras' defective design leaves purchasers vulnerable to cyberattacks.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, November 5, 2019. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-S&P 500, Dow edge up to records; Nasdaq win streak at risk
news_items.lede: * Indexes: Dow up 0.18%, S&P up 0.04%, Nasdaq down 0.12% (Updates with mid-afternoon trading)

news_items.headline: Amazon's Deliveroo deal faces in-depth UK competition probe
news_items.lede: Britain's competition regulator is launching an in-depth investigation into Amazon.com Inc's <AMZN.O> purchase of a stake in online food delivery group Deliveroo after the companies failed to assuage its initial concerns.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, November 5, 2019. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

news_items.headline: UK regulator to further probe Amazon-Deliveroo deal
news_items.lede: Britain's competition watchdog said on Friday it would undertake an in-depth investigation into Amazon.com Inc's purchase of a stake in online food delivery group Deliveroo, weeks after expressing concerns over the deal.

news_items.headline: Nasdaq tops 9,000 on boosts from Amazon, trade optimism
news_items.lede: The Nasdaq crossed the 9,000-point mark for the first time on Thursday as all three major Wall Street indexes posted record closing highs, boosted by optimism over U.S.-China trade relations and gains in shares of Amazon.com after a report signaled robust online holiday...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., December 17, 2019. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Nasdaq tops 9,000 on Amazon; U.S.-China trade optimism drives record rally
news_items.lede: * Indexes up: Dow 0.19%, S&P 0.34%, Nasdaq 0.64% (Updates with mid-afternoon trading)

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Nasdaq, S&P hit fresh highs on trade deal hopes, Amazon boost
news_items.lede: * Indexes rise: 0.17%, S&P 0.27%, Nasdaq 0.47% (Updates prices)

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Nasdaq hits 9,000, S&P at record high on trade deal hopes, Amazon boost
news_items.lede: * Indexes rise: Dow 0.28%, S&P 0.36%, Nasdaq 0.53% (Updates comment, price action)

news_items.headline: Amazon to raise U.S. fulfillment fees 3 percent for merchants next year
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc plans to raise the fees it charges merchants for warehousing and shipping their goods in the United States by an average 3% next year, the company said Friday, as it faces higher costs from infrastructure and programs such as one-day delivery.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Amazon boxes are seen stacked for delivery in the Manhattan borough of New York City, January 29, 2016.    REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo

news_items.headline: German union extends strike at Amazon's Leipzig warehouse until December 24
news_items.lede: Amazon <AMZN.O> workers in the eastern German city of Leipzig will extend until Christmas Eve their strike over pay and conditions, trade union Verdi said on Friday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: An outside view of an Amazon logistics centre in Mannheim, Germany, September 17, 2019. REUTERS/Ralph Orlowski/File Photo

news_items.headline: Amazon to deliver 3.5 billion packages through own network in 2019
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it was on track to deliver 3.5 billion customer packages globally this year through its in-house delivery network.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A delivery cart loaded with a number of packages from Amazon stands on a sidewalk in New York City, New York, U.S., July 25, 2019. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson

news_items.headline: Amazon to deliver 3.5 bln packages through own network in 2019
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it was on track to deliver 3.5 billion customer packages globally this year through its in-house delivery network.

news_items.headline: Apple, Amazon, Google partner to make smart home devices more compatible
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O>, Apple Inc <AAPL.O> and Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google are partnering to lay the groundwork for better compatibility among their smart home products, the companies said on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Prompts on how to use Amazon's Alexa personal assistant are seen as a wifi-equipped Roomba begins cleaning a room in an Amazon ‘experience center’  in Vallejo, California, U.S., May 8, 2018. REUTERS/Elijah Nouvelage
